name: AmericInn Lodge & Suites Griswold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here before heading over to Foxwoods the next day. Location is ideal – right off the highway. Staff was very friendly at check in and check out. The room and halls were very quiet even with being full - just as the hotel advertises. We had a room with 2 queen beds with a mini/fridge/microwave. Decent space for a budget motel with an extra separate sink outside bathroom. The mattresses were very firm and linens a little rough but not a big deal to us for one night. I give the room cleanliness huge pluses and minuses. The room and bathroom were extremely clean. The newer AC unit was great….wasn’t dusty or smelly. Minuses: The room was non smoking but the hallway reeked of smoke and our room had a light scent of smoke. (Gross) The remote corners of the room were very dusty and cobwebby. The carpet could use a good general vacuum. (I never understand why these hotels can’t vacuum room in-between guests.) Note: this hotel charges an optional but automatic fee for the in room safe. (?) You’ll need to request they don’t charge you at check in or a refund when checking out. The breakfast was your basic cereal, bread/donuts etc...all we need is coffee anyway. We did not use the shuttle to Foxwoods but it was about a 20 minute drive through cornfields. A little better quality then some of the other local budget motels. Overally - an ok and average stay for a gambling weekend.
reviews.title: Slightly Better then Average Budget Motel

reviews.text: Not a bad place to stay, but it's not a luxury hotel and on the expensive side considering. I think it's probably so expensive because of the location. It was hard to sleep because the mattresses are very hard, and there was A LOT of light coming in from around the curtains (they were too short and not high up enough to block the light). There was a VERY bright light in the parking lot outside my room, so this really disrupted my sleep. This was a non-smoking room but had a musty smell, like smoke, in the bathroom. Also, this hotels touts extra-quiet walls, but I could hear the tv next door like it was in my room. The staff was nice and all in all it wasn't bad, but not great.
reviews.title: curtains are too short to block out bright light of parking lot

reviews.text: Clearly this is a hotel for the budget-minded traveler, but the breakfast was decent (waffles, bisquits & gravy, cereals, yogurt, fruit, juices, etc.) and the lobby quite comfortable for fellow wedding guests to bump into each other and chat. Comfortable pillows, very good wireless service in the room, cheap amenities but still, everything we needed was provided. The staff was friendly. Not a vacation destination, but good rooming.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, hospitality-oriented, not luxury but all we needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times on our trips to the casinos. Each time has been just fine: clean room, thick and plentiful towels, very quiet room, good breakfast. And the front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. The only thing I noticed was the pool was cloudy but we didn't use the pool anyway. No complaints about this place.......we'll be back. It is virtually impossible to get a room around here on the weekends because of the casinos (which is why rooms are so expensive,) and this place is a 15 minute drive to Mohegan Sun. So my advice is to reserve in advance and don't leave it to chance.
reviews.title: Another fine stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed there last weekend to see a concert at Mohegan Sun . We got the room with the fireplace and Jucuzzi and my husband and I couldn't be happier-we wished we could have stayed longer. The room was big and quiet and the staff was friendly. As a matter of fact, even though my husband and I were the only ones signed up for the shuttle (which I did not see as an option on their website) he (Luther-nice guy) gladly took us to Mohegan Sun and back (which is something I noticed other people complained about at other hotels-if not enough people-no shuttle service). Breakfast was good and we were on our way. For the price and the amenities, this hotel was definately worth it!
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheap bed linens. Below average staff. No auto checkout, long line. If the casinos weren't nearby my guess is this place would be out of business.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were on our 25th anniversary trip and we decided to just play it by ear when it came to lodging. Thankfully, we bumped into this Inn just east of Norwich, CT along I-395 at exit 85. It was very quiet. I was amazed at how quiet this hotel was. Although it was nearly full, it was an oasis from the noise. We stayed in one of the suites which was well-appointed. The whirlpool was great and the breakfast the next morning was much better than most of the chain-hotel breakfasts. It was a very nice stop along the way.
reviews.title: Quiet Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just left the Americ Inn in Griswold after a 5 day stay and couldn't be happier. If this is representative of the chain, I will try to stay with them as much as possible!! The property appears to be newer, and was very clean, including the pool. The room was huge! The soundproofing is excellent - never heard any noise from other rooms. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful, and responded immediately when called from the room with requests (extra towels, etc). The location is right off I-395, so it's handy to anywhere in eastern CT.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel a few years ago for my 30th birthday, had a wonderful time. We are locals who stayed there thid time just to get away for a night and let our children enjoy themselves, since we cannot afford to take an extravagant vacation. When we arrived the staff was pleasant and went above and beyond to help us. When we started the jacuzzi in our room, we noticed that it was a little dirty, we asked if someone was there to clean the tub for us and there was no one else except the front desk attendant. Instead of her coming to clean it for us and leave the desk with no one to attend it, we decided to clean it ourselves. The next day we just wanted to inform the general manager of our concern and she was not around, so we left our number and asked for her to call us. Almost four hours went by without a response. We called her and she was very rude and unprofessional over the phone. She would not compensate us at all and accused us of not having the attendant clean it for us. We were not looking for any compensation, just wanted to voice our opinion and basically were treated with such disrespect that we will not stay there anymore. The customer is always right and does not need to put up with such a downright rude person.
reviews.title: Manager was unprofessional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at AmericInn for the first time and I must say that it was the best experience I have ever had. Everything was perfect. AmericInn has anything and everything that anyone should look for when staying in a hotel. When we checked in our room was not ready yet due to arriving a bit earlier than check in time and the young lady at the front desk named Kirsten was very pleasant and let us swim until our room was ready. Jennifer the general manager and Tracy the assisant were also very pleasant always having smiles on their faces. Everything in our room was excellent. Our room was very clean and housekeeping manager Sandy was very helpful when asking for some extra shampoo and lotion. All facilities including the pool and hot tub were very clean and relaxing. And the best thing besides the FANTASTIC staff were the waffles served in the morning at breakfast.
reviews.title: BEST STAY EVER!!!!

reviews.text: Their web site says they offer a luxury stay. NO WAY.This is the worst hotel I ever stayed in. Manager Jennifer is very rude and unprofessional. I had to bring my dirty towels to the front desk before I could get new ones. They didnt even have extra pillows they had to search the property to locate some which took hours. The pool smelled the first night and was shut down the next night. Management offered no compensation for the inconvience. That why in July they had like litterally six cars in their parking lot. Mattresses are very uncomfortable. Definetly not worth the money. Stay at Foxwoods at least youll get what you pay for. DEFINITELY A WASTE OF MONEY
reviews.title: Awful & rude manager dirty pool - no clean towels
The most terrible hotel experience ever!
reviews.text: First I slipped in the doorway because they did not take care of their hotel properly.They gave me the wrong key card and ended up walking into someone elses room.They charged me for two nights when I only stayed one. They never even seemed like they cared when these things were brought to their attention.Very, very bad mangement!
This was a great place to stay. The rooms were a good size and clean. The non-smoking room had no smoke or chemical smell.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay
Had a great stay.
reviews.text: The lobby was nice and the workers were very nice. The country club near by has great food.

reviews.title: A Great Stay!
reviews.text: The only negative was that I couldn't connect to the high speed internet in the room (there was a workstation in the lobby).

description: The AmericInn Lodge & Suites Griswold is your destination for comfortable, friendly and affordable accommodations near the I-395 business corridor. Visitors to the Mohegan Sun, Foxwoods Resort Casinos and MGM Grand Casino at Foxwoods will enjoy our unbeatable hotel value and free hourly casino shuttle every weekend. (Shuttle reservations must be made in advance.) Relax and enjoy yourself gambling, or taking in a concert or event while we take care of your transportation.(Please contact the hotel direct for shuttle times.) Sports fans will also enjoy our convenient location near venues for the Connecticut Defenders baseball team and Connecticut Sun basketball team. When you're not busy at an event, you'll enjoy our comfortable rooms and vast amenities: a heated indoor pool, hot tub, fireplace and whirlpool suites, free high-speed Internet, new flatscreen TVs in each guest room and more. Start each morning out right with our free hot, home-style breakfast before exploring the Griswold and Norwich areas!
